2. diavik diamond mine: diavik diamond mine is another diamond mine operatesjointly by anglo american and dominion diamond corp in the nwt. they are committed to environmental and social sustainability and have received several awards recognizing their efforts. the mine uses innovative technology and engineering practices for its waste management program, has implemented a rigorous environmental monitoring system, and has initiated several programs to support local communities.

3. gahcho kué diamond mine: gahcho kué is the third diamond mine in the nwt, operated by de beers canada and mountain province diamonds. the mine aims to minimize its environmental impact and has implemented an extensive biodiversity program that includes the reclamation of habitats and restoration of wildlife. the mine's water management plan aims to reduce water use by recycling and reusing water in mining operations.

these three diamond mines in the nwt have implemented sustainable practices and engaged with local communities to ensure they carry out mining activities that respect the environment and promote social responsibility. however, it's always important to note that ensuring sustainability in mining practices is an ongoing process that requires continuous improvement, adaptation and cooperation between the mining industry and all relevant stakeholders.
